trans-unit.source: Handle conflicts with offline data in Mobile Services (iOS) | Mobile Dev Center
trans-unit.target: Handle conflicts with offline data in Mobile Services (iOS) | Mobile Dev Center

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Services to handle conflicts when syncing offline data in your iOS application
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Services to handle conflicts when syncing offline data in your iOS application

trans-unit.source: Handling Conflicts with Offline Data Sync in Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Handling Conflicts with Offline Data Sync in Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to synchronize data and handle conflicts when using the offline capabilities of Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to synchronize data and handle conflicts when using the offline capabilities of Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial builds on the [Get Started with Offline Data] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial builds on the [Get Started with Offline Data] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To complete this tutorial, you need a Azure account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To complete this tutorial, you need a Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see Azure Free Trial.
trans-unit.target: For details, see Azure Free Trial.

trans-unit.source: Download iOS Project
trans-unit.target: Download iOS Project

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, download [an updated Xcode project from Github](https://github.com/Azure/mobile-services-samples/tree/master/TodoOffline/iOS).
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, download [an updated Xcode project from Github](https://github.com/Azure/mobile-services-samples/tree/master/TodoOffline/iOS).

trans-unit.source: We've used the Xcode project from the end of [Get Started with Offline Data] tutorial as a starting point, and then updated it to allow the editing of items.
trans-unit.target: We've used the Xcode project from the end of [Get Started with Offline Data] tutorial as a starting point, and then updated it to allow the editing of items.

trans-unit.source: We've also added supporting classes and methods so we can add a conflict handler in the next section.
trans-unit.target: We've also added supporting classes and methods so we can add a conflict handler in the next section.

trans-unit.source: At the end of this tutorial, if you you run this app on two phones, change the same item on both phones locally, and push the changes back to the server, you'll allow the user on each phone to choose which version to keep:
trans-unit.target: At the end of this tutorial, if you you run this app on two phones, change the same item on both phones locally, and push the changes back to the server, you'll allow the user on each phone to choose which version to keep:

trans-unit.source: keep the client version (which overrides the version on the server),
trans-unit.target: keep the client version (which overrides the version on the server),

trans-unit.source: keep the server version (which updates the client local table), or
trans-unit.target: keep the server version (which updates the client local table), or

trans-unit.source: keep neither version (cancels push and leaves the operation pending).
trans-unit.target: keep neither version (cancels push and leaves the operation pending).

trans-unit.source: Now, let's add the conflict handler to enable this capability.
trans-unit.target: Now, let's add the conflict handler to enable this capability.

trans-unit.source: Add Conflict Handler to Todo List View Controller
trans-unit.target: Add Conflict Handler to Todo List View Controller

trans-unit.source: In **QSTodoListViewController.m**, edit **viewDidLoad**.
trans-unit.target: In **QSTodoListViewController.m**, edit **viewDidLoad**.

trans-unit.source: Replace the call to **defaultService** with a call to **defaultServiceWithDelegate** instead:
trans-unit.target: Replace the call to **defaultService** with a call to **defaultServiceWithDelegate** instead:

trans-unit.source: In **QSTodoListViewController.h**, add **<MSSyncContextDelegate>** to the interface declaration so we're implementing the **MSSyncContextDelegate** protocol.
trans-unit.target: In **QSTodoListViewController.h**, add **<MSSyncContextDelegate>** to the interface declaration so we're implementing the **MSSyncContextDelegate** protocol.

trans-unit.source: Add the following import statement at the top of **QSTodoListViewController.m**:
trans-unit.target: Add the following import statement at the top of **QSTodoListViewController.m**:

trans-unit.source: Finally, let's add the following two operations to **QSTodoListViewController.m** to use this helper class and prompt the user to reconcile the conflict in one of three ways.
trans-unit.target: Finally, let's add the following two operations to **QSTodoListViewController.m** to use this helper class and prompt the user to reconcile the conflict in one of three ways.

trans-unit.source: Test the App
trans-unit.target: Test the App

trans-unit.source: Let's test the application with conflicts!
trans-unit.target: Let's test the application with conflicts!

trans-unit.source: Edit the same item in two different instances of the app running at the same time, or using the app and a REST client.
trans-unit.target: Edit the same item in two different instances of the app running at the same time, or using the app and a REST client.

trans-unit.source: Perform the refresh gesture in the app instances by dragging from the top.
trans-unit.target: Perform the refresh gesture in the app instances by dragging from the top.

trans-unit.source: Now you'll see a prompt to reconcile the conflict:
trans-unit.target: Now you'll see a prompt to reconcile the conflict:
